node.title: Judge John Hodgman on Guests Going Sockless
node.description: Taking your shoes off is polite, but what about going totally foot-naked?
node.content: ["Sam writes: During the peak of Covid, my friend Marissa and I formed a pod and hung out frequently. If I went to her place, I would remove both my shoes and socks. She believes it\u2019s weird for a houseguest to go sockless. Now we\u2019re dating, and she tells everyone about \u201cSockgate.\u201d Please order her to stop teasing me.", "I love a Covid love story, even one with your gross feet stomping all over it. While many guests are invited to remove their shoes when visiting in the United States (and good idea!), you don\u2019t get foot-naked unless explicitly invited (or if your host lives in a cabana). It\u2019s a matter of smell and respect. This was her home, not your sockless WeWork cubicle. Now that you are dating, I definitely approve more liberal nudity (you\u2019re welcome), but even so: If your partner thinks something is \u201cweird,\u201d take the hint, don\u2019t wiggle your toes in contempt. ", "", ""]
